column2: In this story:
Learn about the purpose of the Academy and get to know Ada a little better.
üëç
üëé
Hi again, *{{user_name}}*! I was so excited when Dr. Rowe mentioned that the remote student program was approved.
I know it's not easy - you're the first person to test this system, and you have to deal with a totally new set of people, in a new place...
So, how are you doing?
Wow, you *are* a fast learner. I knew you'd be a good fit here - It's great to see you succeed so easily.
Don't get discouraged - I know it's hard to be so limited in what you can say and do. If you keep going, I'm sure you'll figure it out.
All of us at the Academy are here to support you. We want you to be able to learn whatever you want!
One of our goals is to let you hack *any* program in the operating system. Don't worry, we'll teach you how to do it when the time comes.
Your arrival at The Academy is the start of an exciting journey - We want everyone to learn about computers, programming, and the digital world.
All over the world, people's lives are becoming more and more digital. If you're not connected, you could be left behind.
It hasn't been too long since you had to use a computer to use the internet, and cell phones could only make phone calls.
Now, every cell phone can use the Internet, plus hundreds of different programs - and it's much faster than your old computer was!
All this technology creates new problems, though. The people that control a program or a service get to decide how other people can use it.
For example - If you control a search engine, you control what information people can find with it.
If you own a search engine, and you don't like dogs, you can make it so that nobody can ever find information about dogs. That's a big problem!
This is why you need to learn how these systems work. If you know how something works, you can make it work *for you*, instead of as a way to control you.
Knowing the system means that other people will have a harder time controlling what you can learn, do, or say. That's why learning about all this is so important!
‚Ä¶ Wow, that was quite a speech. Sorry, these things are *REALLY* important to me -  I get all excited to talk about them and just *go*.
Hey Ada, how's it going?
Hi, Faber! I was just seeing how *{{user_name}}* was adjusting to the Academy.

Cool! I actually had some data I wanted to collect - I'm trying to optimize the program that shows your avatar to everyone at The Academy. Hopefully I can keep you from walking through solid objects, and other things like that.
It's funny if you know what to expect, but man, if you popped out of a wall in front of me I'd yell loud enough to wake Dr. Rowe out of a nap!
Haha! I just had the image of you jumping, and everything in your toolbelt flying all over‚Ä¶
Oh, man, you should have seen me yesterday. Dr. Hart surprised me in the Maker Space - I didn't know she was there until she said "I think you missed a connection on this board."

I jumped, my stool tipped over, I fell, and I grabbed the welding bench on the way down... and it flipped over onto me. What a mess. Pretty sure I'll be washing metal chips out of my hair for the next week.
Oh my‚Ä¶ I can just see you, "Waah!" and then the bench goes "CRASH" and Dr. Hart is just looking at you‚Äî

Yeah, she's looking at me like I'm a wrench in the hammer rack. I was so embarrassed! But, you know, she just smiled and helped me up, saying "Does that happen a lot? We should get you a better stool."
That's very kind of her.
Yeah, she's the best, even if she does scare the living daylights out of me sometimes.
It's moments like this that make me so glad I'm here, at the Academy.
If I had left, I'd probably be making some useless gadget for people who don't need more distractions. What about you?
Oh, I imagine I'd be at some research center. Maybe working on gravity waves. This is much more rewarding, though.
So, *{{user_name}}*, how are you feeling about the Academy so far?
Awesome! I love seeing new people get all charged up about this place - it's such a cool opportunity.

Don't worry - Just learn as much as you can. I didn't know what I wanted to do until this one night, when I realized I had been in the machine shop since 10AM that morning... and it was 4AM, the next morning.
What was that noise?

Oh! That's my data collector, it's all finished.
Great talking with you guys, but I gotta run and load this into my program if I want it to finish in time.
In time for what?
Dr. Hart got me a spot on the servers so I can run my simulations... But there's a lot of activity on the servers these days, so I've got a pretty tight deadline.

Good luck, Faber!
Well, *{{user_name}}*, I have to be going - but I'll see you later. Have fun!
